pages.content: Welcome to D. K. Bhave Scholarship Online Application System - Savitribai Phule Pune University D. K. Bhave Damodar Krishna Bhave was born in 1889 in Miraj, Maharashtra, in a financially poor family. He went to Miraj High School (stood first in his matric class), Fergusson College, and then the Engineering College in Pune (Civil Engineering 1910). He started a job, but he wanted to pursue higher education. After taking loans (Hindu Education Fund and others) supplemented by his own savings, he went to Edinburgh, UK, and received his Master's Degree in Civil Engineering with Special Distinction. While working there as an Assistant Engineer for 18 months, he studied at night at the Edinburgh University and earned his MA in Logic and Mathematics. He returned to India, repaid his loans, and held several high level jobs including the Municipal Commissioner of Indore. Education was his passion and he was a supporter of Deccan Education Society and the Savitribai Phule Pune University. In those days (1940s) he insisted on educating women and men equally and supported his daughter to earn her MA at Columbia University in USA. He started a scholarship at Savitribai Phule Pune University in 1950 to aid deserving students going abroad (England, USA and Germany) for graduate degrees in Engineering. He had promised to expand the scholarship to Rs.100,000 to Wrangler Paranjape (the VC at that time), but he passed away before he could do so in 1956. His daughter and sons gave the additional amount in shares he had promised from his estate to the Savitribai Phule Pune University. A donor's representative recently proposed to the Savitribai Phule Pune University to restructure the D. K. Bhave Scholarship to fit today's environment and the Management Council of the University approved the proposal in October 2008. The D. K. Bhave Scholarship for Master's Degree in Engineering and Technology in USA/Canada/Germany/England Online applications are invited for the D. K. Bhave scholarship from engineering graduates who have secured "Confirmed Admission" for Master's Degree in Engineering and Technology in any foreign accredited university from USA/Canada/Germany/England. The Candidate should be Graduate from Engineering Faculty / Studying in the last year (B.E./B.Tech) (Any Branch) of Savitribai Phule Pune University from the NBA (National Board of Accreditation) accredited institutes within PMC and PCMC area. (Please  for the list of colleges) If Your college/department name is not listed here then please contact to Principal of your college and ask him/her to send valid NBA accreditation certificate copy to dkbhave@pun.unipune.ac.in Candidate should have secured "Confirmed Admission" on his/her own merit for Master's Degree in Engineering and Technology in any foreign accredited university from USA/Canada/Germany/England. The purpose is to encourage students to return to India after their Masters Degree and help India to compete in the global economy. For the D. K. Bhave scholarship, the students who are already in a foreign country attending a Masters Degree program in Engineering are not eligible. The expected amount of Scholarship will be around Rs. 5 lacs. Start Date of Online Application: 17 /03/2025 Last Date of Online Application Process: 30/05/2025 . Duly signed application form (2 Pages). Copy of recommendation letter from Director/Principal of the College Your One/two-page writeup (statement of purpose) with your signature. A copy of the "Confirmed Admission Letter" issued by the concerned University or Institute. the final year mark list of B.E. / B. Tech. (if not available then 7th Semester Mark list) copy of the passport, PAN card and Aadhar card. Copy of permanent address proof (electricity bill/telephone bill) Aadhar card copy of one of the parents Address proof of Parents containing detailed postal address Any other achievement while pursuing the B.E./B.Tech. (Research Papers not be included), Certificates of participations/winner of a Competition etc. Queries regarding eligibility will not be entertained on this E-mail Instruction/information related to the D. K. Bhave Scholarship available on this website only is authentic and applicable. Instruction/information obtained through any other means (eg. on telephone / personnel from the office of the department) may not be entertained and/or applicable The Selection Committee wants to maintain the transparent process of selection, free of any undue influence. Therefore if the Committee finds that attempts are made to influence the Committee on behalf of a candidate then, in the sole discretion of the Committee, the candidate will be disqualified. The decision of the Committee in this regard is final; there is no appeal.    If you are already registered to online D. K. Bhave Scholarship registration system then click on following button.

pages.content: Que. 1. What do I mean by ACCREDITED UNIVERSITIES IN America, Canada, United Kingdom and Germany? Answer: The University must be accredited in its country. The accrediting body for each country is listed below: USA: Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET) Canada: Canadian Engineering Accreditation Board of the Canadian Council of Professional Engineers. UK: Engineering Council United Kingdom (ECUK) Germany: ASIIN For more information please visit http://www.accreditation.org Que. 2. What is the deadline for the online application? Answer: Start Date of Online Application: 17/03/2025 Last Date of Online Application Process: 30/05/2025 Que. 3. What is the eligibility to apply for this scholarship? Answer: The student should be Graduate from Engineering Faculty / Studying in the last year (B.E. / B. Tech) (Any Branch) from any of the ACCREDITED Colleges and programs from PMC and PCMC jurisdiction (Please  for the list of colleges). Que. 4. What is the process of application for D. K. Bhave Scholarship? Answer: Please follow the steps mentioned on the link below: www.unipune.ac.in/dkbhave Que. 5. What is the Application Process fee for D. K. Bhave Scholarship? Answer: There is no application fee as such, but the online submission of the application form along with the required document as mentioned on the website of D.K.Bhave scholarship is mandatory. For more information please visit https://app1.unipune.ac.in/dkbhave/howtoapplydkb.htm Que. 6. If a candidate is already enrolled in either of the university from USA/Canada/UK/Germany and studying there since last year, Is he/she eligible for the availing the D. K. Bhave Scholarship Answer: No. He / She is not eligible to get the Scholarship. Even if such a student applies through the online process then his/her candidature stands cancelled. Que. 7. Can I get contact information to get more information about the process? Answer: The candidate is supposed to get information from the website only. If some clarification is required then then the candidate is supposed to email on dkbhave@pun.unipune.ac.in Que. 8. What are the conditions the candidate (beneficiary student) who is awarded the scholarship should follow? The beneficiary student of this scholarship will have to maintain the academic record/performance (Grade B OR HIGHER) and it is essential for the student to submit the academic progress report to the Savitribai Phule Pune University along with the transcript. The beneficiary student, going abroad under this Scholarship will have to return to India after completion of his/her s degree of two years or he/she will have to return the scholarship amount to Savitribai Phule Pune University. There is no interest on this loan. The beneficiary student, returning to India after completion of his/her s degree of two years and working in the same field for five years in India, will not have to make repayment of the scholarship amount to Savitribai Phule Pune University. The Selection Committee of Savitribai Phule Pune University will take the decision regarding return of scholarship. The student has to give the undertaking to Savitribai Phule Pune University regarding his returning back to India after completion of s degree of two years. The beneficiary student of this scholarship will have to submit the related papers (certificate from the Company in India, Nature of work, Tenure of the Service, Passport etc.) regarding return of scholarship, if required, in the format given. Que. 9. How much funding can I get from the Scholarship? Answer: Ideally the student should have secured some funding from family, loans or other financial assistance from Indian or foreign sources. This scholarship will provide the supplemental amount and will not be the sole source of funding for any student. This scholarship will provide a maximum amount equal to 50% of the total cost of one year for a Master’s degree program in Engineering. The total cost per year is defined as cost of tuition, books, room, food and incidental expenses as estimated by the admitting university and reduced by any financial assistance provided by the admitting University. For example, if the total cost per year is $28,000 and the admitting University provides $10,000 as tuition assistance, then the maximum amount provided by this scholarship is $9000, i.e. 50% of (28,000 – 10,000). Generally the scholarship amount will be between 5 to 6 Lacs Rupees. Que. 10. What will be covered by the released/sanctioned amount of the scholarship? Answer: The scholarship does not pay expenses for travel, visa fees, GRE and other examination fees, application fees etc. The funds are sent directly to the foreign university for the benefit of the selected candidate. They are used for Tution, books, room, food and incidental expenses estimated by the foreign university where the student got the admission. Que. 11. I got direct admission to Ph.D. Program, am I eligible to get the scholarship? Answer: No. Students getting “direct” admission for the Ph. D. program (i.e. without the possibility of getting the Master’s Degree first and be able to leave the University) are not eligible. Que. 12. What happens if attempts are made to influence the committee on behalf of the candidate? Answer: The Selection Committee wants to maintain the transparent process of selection, free of any undue influence. Therefore if the Committee finds that attempts are made to influence the Committee on behalf of a candidate then, in the sole discretion of the Committee, the candidate will be disqualified. The decision of the Committee in this regard is final; there is no appeal.

pages.content: I am doing my Master of Science in Civil Engineering with focus on Structural Engineering. Currently, I am working on my research thesis in steel connection design. I was offered scholarship from University of Cincinnati for graduate study in Civil Engineering. This scholarship covered 75% of my tuition fees. Rest of the fees were covered by DKB scholarship for the first two semesters of my graduate study. Tuition fee is the most significant expense while studying abroad and thanks to DKB scholarship, I didn’t have to worry about it. It helped me to focus on my studies. Apart from offering financial support, it encouraged me to keep working hard towards my career goals. I received DKB scholarship in two phases. In phase I, I received $3786.00 and in phase II $3814.00. Though the offered amount was Rs. 5 Lakhs, I didn’t receive the full amount of the scholarship. Currently, DKB scholarship is offered to only few students per year. It would be great if we could increase the number of beneficiaries. As my way of giving back to society, I would definitely make donations to DKB funds in near future. Also, if required, I will always be available to help out the Savitribai Phule Pune University in whatever way I can to the best of my abilities and expertise. Currently pursuing Masters in Industrial & Systems Engineering at Rochester Institute of technology. DKB scholarship has helped me to keep myself focused on the studies. Instead of getting into an on campus job in first semester itself, I concentrated more on my course work due to the financial stability provided by DKB Scholarship. It helped me achieving good grades.I am awarded with a scholarship of five lakh rupees. I can guide the student who will be offered this scholarship next year in terms of course work and general educational structure in USA. Definitely after coming back to India I will like to share my experiences and valuable learning with the university students who aspire to pursue graduate degree abroad. I am Sumeet Jadhav, pursuing masters in fire protection engineering at University of Maryland, College Park.Previously, I have completed my bachelors in mechanical engineering from College of Engineering, Pune (COEP). Last year I had applied for the D.K. Bhave scholarship granted by Savitribai Phule Pune University which helps students with their financial needs who desire to pursue masters outside India and I was one of the recipient of the scholarship. It helped me in contributing 5 lakh rupees towards my university tuition fees. The big difference this scholarship made was, I didn’t need to take a loan from bank because this scholarship covered a big chunk of my initial expenses.Further, the scholarship is granted in two parts, 2.5 lakh rupees for first two semesters which helps you to minimize your tuition expenses for a whole year. So you are not burdened with any kind of loan or high expense for a year or so. I would really like to recommend students to apply for this scholarship and get the benefit from it. My name is Aishwarya Hendre, I am a computer engineering graduate student at North Carolina State University. I completed by undergraduate from MIT, pune a college affiliated with Savitribai Phule Pune University. This same time last year I had an admit in hand, my courses and decision to join NC state was almost finalized, but finances was the only concern pulling me back. My loan was in the process of sanctioning, however I knew for a fact that the loan amount wouldn’t be sufficient and I needed some other assistance. It was then that I heard about the prestigious D.K.Bhave scholarship. When I applied I hadn’t thought I would get it, but I did. And I am indebted for life to the founders of this scholarship program and all other who made sure it happened for whatever success and education that I am receiving today. The selection process for this scholarship program is completely fair and purely based on merit and I can proudly say that I am one of those deserving people who received the D.K.Bhave scholarship. The scholarship helped me kick start my education journey here in USA smoothly and released pressure off me so that I could concentrate well on my studies. My name is Umema Bohari, and I am currently working with Schlumberger Technological Corportation in Houston, USA on post-completion OPT as a Mechanical Engineer with the R&D Department. My work here is at the interafce of new product development, data anaytics and engineering on Schlumberger's downhole completion tools. I completed my MS in Mechanical Engineering in August 2018 from the Department of Mechanical Engineering, Texas A&M University. As a part of my MS, I completed a thesis on developing intelligent machine learning human behavioral models for intuitive human-computer interaction - all for the service of product design and engineering. I have published 2 conference articles on my research, presented one at the ACM Intelligent User Interfaces conference in Tokyo, Japan; and another at IDETC 2018 in Canada. I have two manuscripts currently under review with IEEE Human-Machine Systems, and the Journal of Mechanical Design. During my time at Texas A&M, I was also awarded the Emil Beuhler Graduate Excellence Fellowship for outstanding academic and co-curricular performance. When I look back at the two years at Texas A&M, I realize that a major chunk of this would not have been possible without the D K Bhave scholarship that I received in 2016. I remember the financial conundrum I was in when I had 4 admits and a difficult funding scenario. My professor from College of Engineering Pune referred me to the D K Bhave scholarship, and things really have been easier since then. For this, I will always be indebted to the D K Bhave Scholarship, its founders, and everybody at the University of Pune associated with it. I am Soniya Shah a bachelor student of College of Engineering, Pune. Having studied in a prestigiuos college in my Bachelors always inspired me to do new and different things in my career. I worked for Tata Motors in production field which was a challenging experience. Then I decided to do my masters also in the production field and not having a herd mentality, I chose a different track in a country and city which not many masters students then would choose(against the options in USA). Currently I am studying in Aachen, Germany at the the renowned RWTH AACHEN UNIVERSITY. I chose the course called management and Engineering in Production Systems which combines management studies and production technical knowledge. When I knew about this course and its fees I was a little worried if I would be able to take a loan and complete all this. But fortunately during that time I received the DK Bhave scholarship which encouraged me to keep dreaming. As a result of this strength I also applied for german Women in Engineering scholarship and to my surprise received it. These helped me to start my dream without worry of the money side. The DK Bhave team at the Pune university supported me throughout the process amd guided me when necessary. I would say they became like a famipy then who wamted their daughter to pursue her dreams. I am obliged to be a part of this family. I have just completed my third semester and will soon be starting with my fourth. I am also obliged to inform you that I have been awarded the best of class awards for previous semesters. I am happy to inform you that for my fourth semester I have got an internship at the AUDI company. Again receiving such a great opportunity to observe closely the production in one of a german best selling car company will only help me to hone my skills further. I am highly greatful to the DK Bhave scholarship which has been the biggest supporting hand for my financials in Germany. Because of DKB scholarship I have been able to be carefree and concentrate on my studies and future endeavours and move closer towards them. I hope the opportunities I am getting here will help me in my future plans in India later.I hope the DKB family continues its support in the same way further and i would be obliged if I can help DKB family in any form in the future. Receiving the scholarship has allowed me to concentrate on my studies without the stress of financial burdens during my early semesters and has given me the opportunity to study at my dream university. Thank you for making a meaningful difference in my academic journey. In the near future, I aspire to work at the intersection of AI and business, leveraging technology to drive innovation and create solutions that leave a lasting impact on society. I am also eager to support Savitribai Phule Pune University in any way I can by contributing my skills and expertise whenever needed. My name is Sneha Parthe, and I am honored to be the proud recipient of the DK Bhave Scholarship 2024. I completed my bachelor’s degree in engineering from AISSMS Institute of Information Technology, Pune. I am currently pursuing my master’s in computer science and engineering at The Ohio State University, USA. I am deeply grateful for the support provided through this scholarship. It has significantly eased the financial burden of studying abroad, allowing me to focus more wholeheartedly on my academic and personal growth. I sincerely thank everyone involved in making this opportunity possible—your belief in my potential means a lot. This generous assistance not only motivates me to strive for excellence but also inspires me to give back to society. I hope to use the skills and knowledge I gain through my education to make a meaningful contribution—not just in the field of technology, but also in the lives of other students. I aspire to mentor, inspire, and support others the way I have been supported. Once again, I extend my heartfelt thanks for the DK Bhave, Scholarship. It is a source of strength, encouragement, and responsibility that I carry with great pride and gratitude.
